reqs: This course offers an introduction to contemporary ethical issues. The course may offer a survey of various issues (e.g. the ethical treatment of animals, the ethics of food, drug legalization, offensive speech and behaviour; the ethics of war and peace; sexism, racism, and reparation) or it may focus on a detailed exploration of one central debate in contemporary ethics. No prior familiarity with philosophy is required.
description: Moral issues such as life and death decisions, paternalism, markets, animal welfare, technology, and global justice.
